author: mrabino1
content: question.. once we have the "docking"... I am curious how missed blocks will be handled. In PoW, it is a race condition to produce a solution to the block given the difficulty. Thus if miner A is not avail, miner B (or C etc) will beat him to posting a solution. In PoS, a validator is assigned.. so if that validator is offline, what happens to those transactions? are they all just punted to the next block? or will an alternate step forward? or will (or even should) each block have a primary and a backup validator? (appreciated in advance).

author: m.kalinin
content: Transactions will be included in a block produced in a slot next to the missed one, akin to attestations on the beacon chain

author: mrabino1
content: clarifying.. does that basically means transactions would sit in the mempool longer and just be deferred to the next block?

author: m.kalinin
content: Yes, it can stay longer in some cases. In the PoW chain it stays longer as well from time to time due to probabilistic nature of PoW, the time between a pair of PoW blocks is not a constant
